answers.answer: Sugar can aggravate anxiety and caffeine has a definite impact on our anxiety.
Everyone has different reactions, but there seems to be a commonality with the caffiene.  Not sure about sugar, but there are some proponents of a sugar-free diet to control anxiety symptoms.

Absolutly.  I cannot have caffine at all.  (well unless if I eat a lot of things non caffinated, then eat or drink a little something with caffine im usually fine)...but sugar sets me off too.  I cannot at all eat a lot of sugar in a day other wise I have anxiety for a good 2 days after.  Try to avoid eating a lot of things with sugar and caffine.

Caffeine most definitely, but the idea that sugar causes hyperactivity (as in the common thought process of kids not eating too much or they'll bounce off the walls....) is actually a myth, it is not true.  Our bodies are made to process what we put in it, therefore, unless there is something wrong with those processes (ie diabetes, etc)...then sugar should not affect us in the way we have been taught it does.Certainly eating a lot of sugar ini the long run isn't the healthiest choice and may lead to other issues that may indirectly aggravate anxiety, such as weight gain...but it does not actually trigger any kind of hyperactivity.

Sugar does nothing good at all for us, and if you have a sensitivity to it, it can make your anxiety worse.  We get a lot of sugar in everyday food products and by not watching your intake, it can lead to diabetes and heart problems along with many other health issues.  I am sensitive to sugar and can feel a differece if I drink just one can of soda.  Nor are our bodies equipped to handle the huge amount of sugars we take in.  Too much of anything is not good, it's all about portion control.  Our anxiety is as individual as we are, and we need to pay close attention to the things that make our anxiety worse.
